meanings.definition: The foremost part or area of a military operation.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers bravely fought on the frontlines.
meanings.sent2: The general strategized the movement of troops on the frontlines.
meanings.sent3: The frontlines were so busy that even the birds stayed away.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawns are like the frontlines protecting the king.
meanings.sent5: The image of the frontlines stayed etched in his memory forever.

meanings.definition: The most advanced or innovative position in a field or activity.
meanings.sent1: The company's research team worked on the frontlines of technology.
meanings.sent2: She was at the frontlines of the fashion industry, setting trends.
meanings.sent3: The frontlines of science are constantly pushing the boundaries of knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Being at the frontlines of change requires courage and vision.
meanings.sent5: The frontlines of innovation are where new ideas come to life.
